title: Is There A Cyber War Between U.S. And North Korea?
teaser: Here & Now's security analyst Jim Walsh explains what this most recent hacking means for the future of cyber security?
contentencoded:
Internet services have been on and off in North Korea.

There’s now word of whether the U.S. has been involved in the outages, since last week President Obama said there should be a proportional response to what the administration believes was North Korea’s attack on Sony Pictures computers.

The attack forced the company to cancel the holiday release of the film “The Interview,” which features an assassination plot against North Korea’s leaders.

So, how did a country that has slightly more than 1,000 Internet protocol addresses become such a player here?

Here & Now security analyst Jim Walsh joins host Robin Young to talk about the most recent hacking.

  • Earlier Coverage: Sony Puts News Groups On Legal Notice To Destroy Hacked Data

Guest

  • Jim Walsh, Here & Now security analyst with the security studies program at MIT. He tweets @drjimwalshmit.
